Package model

Class Book

java.lang.Object
model.BibliographicProduct
model.Book
All Implemented Interfaces:
CreateID
public class Book extends BibliographicProduct
The Book class extends the BibliographicProduct class and includes variables for review and gender, as well as methods for setting these variables and generating a random hexadecimal ID.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book(String nameProduct, int numberPages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, double valueProduct, String review, int gender)
      The Book class represents a bibliographic product of type book, which extends from the BibliographicProduct class. It includes information about the review and gender of the book.
      Parameters:
      nameProduct - The name of the book.
      numberPages - The number of pages in the book.
      publicationDate - The publication date of the book.
      url - The url where the book can be found.
      valueProduct - The value of the book.
      review - The review of the book.
      gender - The gender of the book.

  • Method Details

    • setReview

      public void setReview(String review)
      This function sets the review for a particular object.
      Parameters:
      review - The parameter "review" is a String that represents the review of a product or service. The method "setReview" sets the value of the instance variable "review" to the value passed as a parameter.

    • setGender

      public void setGender(GenderType gender)
      This function sets the gender of an object to a specified gender type.
      Parameters:
      gender - a variable of type GenderType that represents the gender of a person. The method setGender() sets the value of this variable.

    • createID

      public String createID()
      The function generates a random hexadecimal ID with a length of 3 digits.
      Returns:
      A randomly generated hexadecimal ID code with a length of 3 characters.

    • getReview

      This function returns a string representing a review.

      The method `getReview()` is returning a `String` value, which is the value of the variable `review`.
